page.title: 03Commander Gammon's Talk
page.content: At 10am on Monday 17th June{Commander {Gammon,}a local amateur historian came to our school to give us a lecture about our study area. He brought his slides and projector and when everything was ready Mr Little introduced him. At first he explained how the whole area was shaped in the ice age and that over thousands of years the sea and rivers slowly altered the land and the estuary, and continue to do so. His slides were taken over a number of years and as the slides flicked over he talked about floods, sand erosion and notable dates in history affecting the area. { The Marsh}has been used for grazing cattle and sheep since saxon days, but it must have been very wet and boggy especially when there were Spring Tides.
